Package mz.intro

Class IntroAnother

java.lang.Object
mz.SortComparable
mz.intro.IntroAnother
All Implemented Interfaces:
InsertionInterface<Comparable>, Intro<Comparable>, QuickInterface<Comparable>, Sort<Comparable>, SortSwap<Comparable>
Direct Known Subclasses:
IntroDPQAnother
public abstract class IntroAnother extends SortComparable implements Intro<Comparable>
Intro Another Sort is a hybrid sorting algorithm that combines the strengths of Quick Sort and any Another Sort. It aims to provide fast average-case performance while maintaining worst-case guarantees. The basic idea behind Intro Sort is to start with Quick Sort, which is known for its efficiency on average, but has a worst-case time complexity of O(n^2) in certain scenarios. To mitigate the risk of Quick Sort's worst-case behavior, any Another Sort monitors the recursion depth during the sorting process. If the depth exceeds a certain threshold, the algorithm switches to HeapSort, which guarantees worst-case O(n log(n)) time complexity but has higher overhead. Additionally, for small subarrays, Another switches to Another Sort, which has good performance for small input sizes.
Since:
1.0
Author:
Magyar Zolt√°n

  • Constructor Details

    • IntroAnother

      public IntroAnother()
      Intro Another Sort:
      Is a hybrid sorting algorithm that combines the strengths of Quick Sort and any Another Sort. It aims to provide fast average-case performance while maintaining worst-case guarantees. The basic idea behind Intro Sort is to start with Quick Sort, which is known for its efficiency on average, but has a worst-case time complexity of O(n^2) in certain scenarios.

      To mitigate the risk of Quick Sort's worst-case behavior, Another Sort monitors the recursion depth during the sorting process. If the depth exceeds a certain threshold, the algorithm switches to Another Sort. Implements an adaptive sorting algorithm called Intro Sort Interface.

      Example:
      1. This condition checks if the size of the subarray is greater than INTRO_SIZE. If true, the array is large enough to be sorted using QuickSort.
      2. This condition checks if the maximum depth has been reached. If true, the maximum depth has been exceeded, and the sorting algorithm switches to another sorting method is Another Sort
      3. If the maximum depth has been reached, the sort the subarray using a different sorting algorithm.
      4. If the maximum depth has not been reached, the to perform the partitioning step of QuickSort. It returns the index of the pivot element.
      5. The recursively called on the left subarray (elements smaller than the pivot) to further sort it.
      6. The recursively called on the right subarray (elements greater than the pivot) to further sort it.
      7. Else the size of the subarray is not greater than INTRO_SIZE, the array is considered small, and the perform insertion sort on the subarray.
      8. This is a abstract method declaration. It appears to be a separate sorting algorithm that is called when the maximum depth is reached.
      Note:
      Implements an adaptive sorting algorithm called Intro Sort. It combines the Quick Sort algorithm with a switch to another sorting algorithm Another Sort when the recursion depth exceeds a specified threshold maxDepth. The purpose of this adaptive approach is to optimize performance by leveraging the strengths of different sorting algorithms depending on the input size.

      Property:
      Worst Case Complexity: O(?)
      Best Case Complexity: O(?)
      Average Case Complexity: O(?)
      Auxiliary Space: O(?)
      Stability: No
      See Also:
      • IntroDPQAnother

    • introRecursiveInc

      public void introRecursiveInc(Comparable[] array, int left, int right, int maxDepth)
      introRecursiveInc method implements an adaptive sorting algorithm called Intro Sort.
      • This condition checks if the size of the subarray is greater than INTRO_SIZE. If true, the array is large enough to be sorted using QuickSort.
      • This condition checks if the maximum depth has been reached. If true, the maximum depth has been exceeded, and the sorting algorithm switches to another sorting method.
      • introSortClassInc(array, left, right): If the maximum depth has been reached, the introSortClassInc method is called to sort the subarray using a different sorting algorithm.
      • partitionInc(array, left, right): If the maximum depth has not been reached, the partitionInc method is called to perform the partitioning step of QuickSort. It returns the index of the pivot element.
      • The introRecursiveInc method is recursively called on the left subarray (elements smaller than the pivot) to further sort it.
      • The introRecursiveInc method is recursively called on the right subarray (elements greater than the pivot) to further sort it.
      • Else the size of the subarray is not greater than INTRO_SIZE, the array is considered small, and the introSortClass2Inc method is called to perform Another sort on the subarray.
      • This is a method declaration for introSortClassInc. It appears to be a separate sorting algorithm that is called when the maximum depth is reached.
      introRecursiveInc method implements an adaptive sorting algorithm called Another Sort. It combines the Quick Sort algorithm with a switch to another sorting algorithm Another Sort when the recursion depth exceeds a specified threshold maxDepth. The purpose of this adaptive approach is to optimize performance by leveraging the strengths of different sorting algorithms depending on the input size.
      Specified by:
      introRecursiveInc in interface Intro<Comparable>
      Parameters:
      array - The array to be sorted.
      left - The starting index of the subarray to be sorted.
      right - The ending index (inclusive) of the subarray to be sorted.
      maxDepth - The maximum depth or recursion level allowed before switching to another sorting algorithm.
      See Also:
      • Intro.INTRO_SIZE
      • Intro.introSortClassInc(Comparable[], int, int)
      • QuickInterface.partitionInc(Comparable[], int, int)
      • introSortClass2Inc(Comparable[], int, int)

    • introRecursiveDec

      public void introRecursiveDec(Comparable[] array, int left, int right, int maxDepth)
      introRecursiveDec method implements an adaptive sorting algorithm called Intro Sort.
      • This condition checks if the size of the subarray is greater than INTRO_SIZE. If true, the array is large enough to be sorted using QuickSort.
      • This condition checks if the maximum depth has been reached. If true, the maximum depth has been exceeded, and the sorting algorithm switches to another sorting method.
      • introSortClassDec(array, left, right): If the maximum depth has been reached, the introSortClassDec method is called to sort the subarray using a different sorting algorithm.
      • partitionDec(array, left, right): If the maximum depth has not been reached, the partitionDec method is called to perform the partitioning step of QuickSort. It returns the index of the pivot element.
      • The introRecursiveDec method is recursively called on the left subarray (elements smaller than the pivot) to further sort it.
      • The introRecursiveDec method is recursively called on the right subarray (elements greater than the pivot) to further sort it.
      • Else the size of the subarray is not greater than INTRO_SIZE, the array is considered small, and the introSortClass2Inc method is called to perform insertion sort on the subarray.
      • This is a method declaration for introSortClassDec. It appears to be a separate sorting algorithm that is called when the maximum depth is reached.
